instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No picture
threads.message:
Hello Everybody 

This machine came from no picture problem at display (chime ok) . Someone reflowed or reball GPU. Its looking like generic GPU problem so replaced chip (216-0810005) now LCD backlight is ok but no picture. (LCD back round is black like new macbook s boot screen ) replaced 4 times chip but all time same issue ( also have different data code chips 16 and 12 ) now i think different problem now stopped my brain:( Any idea?

- USB mouse light is not up but i cant be sure its must be this model?  
- Chime ok,
- Tried known good LCD and data cables.
- <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> voltage is ok. 

Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No picture
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No picture
threads.message: Tested external display [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER]  but same issue lcd detect data signal but shows black screen ( came backlight but black screen)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No picture
threads.message: VRAM issue likely. Inspect VRAM area for missing resistors, replace VRAM.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No picture
threads.message: Thank you [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER]  replaced all VRAM with same model Hynix memory but nothing change. I think too much time and chip spend for this machine:( I ll send back.
